CatDescriptText: David Panill, 170 Bonifay Street, Democrat, 16th Ward, and Gertrude Brown, 180 Bonifay Street, Republican, 16th ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 14, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Who is your Ward Chairman? Does he have any power? Does he exert his power?" Mr. Panill's answer reads: "No, I don't know the ward chairman.  And to my knowledge, he doesn't have any power.  But I must add that I've been sick and haven't been able to get around much."  Mrs. Brown's answer reads: "No, I don't know the ward chairman.  The reason is that I haven't been in politics.  Whoever he is, he probably does not have any power here because this is a Democratic ward.  There are only about a dozen Republicans here.  I'm more, much more, interested in Cleaves Temple CME Church than I am in politics."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of David Panill wearing suspenders and Gertrude Brown standing on street in St. Clair Village
